• About Dripless Candles
These candles are considered "drip resistant" under ideal conditions, but as with any candle, they may drip if NOT placed in the ideal conditions.

What normally causes a candle to drip is:
• Draft (even the slightest draft with cause a candles to drip)
• Burning candles close together (if too close, the flame from one candle will melt away another candles side and cause it to drip)
• Candles leaning in an angle

name: Ivy Unity Candle
description:
This gorgeously outrageous unity candle is our new favorite! This candle will look fabulous showcased in the home after your special day. A true collector's piece.

• Austrian crystals - round cut 
• Silver glass beading 
• Dripless Candle 
• 9" x 3" Pillar Candle (matching tapers are available in our store) 
• Available in antique white or ivory

• About Dripless Candles 
These candles are considered "drip resistant" under ideal conditions, but as with any candle, they may drip if NOT placed in the ideal conditions.

What normally causes a candle to drip is: 
• Draft (even the slightest draft with cause a candles to drip) 
• Burning candles close together (if too close, the flame from one candle will melt away another candles side and cause it to drip) 
• Candles leaning in an angle

Please allow 3-4 weeks production time for domestic orders & 4-6 weeks production time for international orders. Please view our store policies for more information on returns, custom orders, etc.

name: Gina Unity Candle
description:
This exquisite appliqué features pear, round and marquise cut crystals.

• Austrian crystals - round, pear & marquise cut
• Silver glass beading 
• Dripless Candle
• 9" x 3" Pillar Candle (matching tapers are available in our store)
• Available in antique white or ivory

• About Dripless Candles
These candles are considered "drip resistant" under ideal conditions, but as with any candle, they may drip if NOT placed in the ideal conditions.

What normally causes a candle to drip is:
• Draft (even the slightest draft with cause a candles to drip)
• Burning candles close together (if too close, the flame from one candle will melt away another candles side and cause it to drip)
• Candles leaning in an angle
